messages.subject: Re: [AlwaysLearning] this list - again
messages.msgSnippet: Karen, Congratulations that sounds so cool! With it being round how do you hang pictures? Boy does that sound silly. Oh well won t know unless I ask. I want to
messages.messageBody:
Karen,
Congratulations that sounds so cool! With it being round how do you hang
pictures? Boy does that sound silly. Oh well won't know unless I ask.
I want to move so bad but it must not be bad enough because we're still
here. ;-)


Barb E
"We live in a wonderful world that is full of beauty,
charm and adventure. There is no end to the adventures
that we can have if only we seek them with our eyes open."

- Jawaharlal Nehru, Prime Minister of India




on 5/19/03 11:04 PM, Karin at curtkar@... wrote:

> You'll get to see our new house that we are buying. The deal closes this
> Wednesday and then it's ours. We're moving in this weekend!
>
> We're going to be living in a round, earth-sheltered, two-story, basement
> home. Yep, that means there's dirt on the roof!
> There are hardly any vertical walls - most've'm are curved because the house
> really is completely round. It's cool! I hope we like living there - it's
> really different and unique.

> See ya in a few months <g>
>
> Karin

messages.subject: Re: [AlwaysLearning] this list - again
messages.msgSnippet: ... Wow, Kelly, sounds like quite a trip! I m officially inviting you, then. I m glad that I m *kinda* on the way to Sandra s house so I get visitors here in
messages.messageBody:
kbcdlovejo@... wrote:


>Not THAT soon! I have a conference to put on! Maybe next spring. Will the
>offer still be good? Were thinking of taking 4-6 weeks and travelling the
>country. I'd like to see you and Mary and Karin and the Pams and Sandra and
>well...anyone who lives "on the way".

Wow, Kelly, sounds like quite a trip! I'm officially inviting you, then. I'm
glad that I'm *kinda* on the way to Sandra's house so I get visitors here in
Arizona, too. <g>

You'll get to see our new house that we are buying. The deal closes this
Wednesday and then it's ours. We're moving in this weekend!

We're going to be living in a round, earth-sheltered, two-story, basement
home. Yep, that means there's dirt on the roof!
There are hardly any vertical walls - most've'm are curved because the house
really is completely round. It's cool! I hope we like living there - it's
really different and unique.

But that's one reason why I've been SO busy lately. Moving is really hard
and quite overwhelming! But we're excited, and taking one step at a time.
There sure is a lot to do.....


>And I'm still waiting for your conference registration! We have
scholarships
>available, ya' know!

~Kelly >>

I am definitely registering any day now - before June 1 for SURE.
I already bought tickets to fly there - except we are flying into Charlotte,
NC and driving down to Columbia for the conference. With our family of four,
I was able to save about $600 (total) doing it that way - tickets to
Charlotte are a lot more reasonably priced. I got a good deal on Hotwire. So
anyway, we're going! Woohoo!

See ya in a few months <g>

Karin

messages.subject: Re: [AlwaysLearning] this list - again
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 5/19/2003 8:39:42 PM Eastern Daylight Time, ... You bet! You may be the first stop!  ~Kelly [Non-text portions of this message have been
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 5/19/2003 8:39:42 PM Eastern Daylight Time,
Tuckervill@... writes:
> Of course, you have to drive through fly-over country, and both Memphis
> (where I am now) and Little Rock (where I hope to be then) are on I-40

You bet! You may be the first stop! <g>

~Kelly


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]

messages.subject: Re: [AlwaysLearning] this list - again
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 5/19/2003 8:23:59 PM Eastern Daylight Time, ... SO COOL! Bring photos in August---or post them here! so we all can see. ... I can t wait! I
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 5/19/2003 8:23:59 PM Eastern Daylight Time,
curtkar@... writes:
> Wow, Kelly, sounds like quite a trip! I'm officially inviting you, then. I'm
> glad that I'm *kinda* on the way to Sandra's house so I get visitors here
> in
> Arizona, too. <g>
>
> You'll get to see our new house that we are buying. The deal closes this
> Wednesday and then it's ours. We're moving in this weekend!
>
> We're going to be living in a round, earth-sheltered, two-story, basement
> home. Yep, that means there's dirt on the roof!
> There are hardly any vertical walls - most've'm are curved because the
> house
> really is completely round. It's cool! I hope we like living there - it's
> really different and unique.


SO COOL! Bring photos in August---or post them here! so we all can see.

> I am definitely registering any day now - before June 1 for SURE.
> I already bought tickets to fly there - except we are flying into
> Charlotte,
> NC and driving down to Columbia for the conference. With our family of
> four,
> I was able to save about $600 (total) doing it that way - tickets to
> Charlotte are a lot more reasonably priced. I got a good deal on Hotwire.
> So
> anyway, we're going! Woohoo!
>
> See ya in a few months <g>

I can't wait!

I guess most of you know that I put on the conference last year for totally
selfish reasons---because I wanted to meet all of you. It worked! <BWG> And
this year I get to meet even more! I'm glad we have a bigger hotel, 'cause
we're going to need it!

To have our online friendships is pretty neat, but to actually MEET you guys
IRL is truly amazing!

~Kelly, the selfish---and proud of it! <G>
